text: My bill, the No Taxpayer-Funded Art in Embassies Act, would stop tax dollars from being needlessly spent on this art instead of going toward addressing real issues facing Americans. You can read the bill text below (2/2) https://t.co/q2ou0SVI7q

.@StateDept informed Congress it intends to spend over $2 million on 10 pieces of art for embassies. Americans are struggling to pay for gas and groceries because of skyrocketing inflation, but the Biden administration is happy to spend MILLIONS of taxpayer dollars on art? (1/2)

I joined @JackieDeAngelis on Evening Edit to discuss how we can make schools safer for our children. We can all agree something needs to be done, and ensuring schools have the necessary resources to secure their facilities is a simple but necessary step we should take. https://t.co/gI7QgIkGg1

The United States cannot afford to blindly send billions of dollars to Ukraine while we deal with record-high inflation and gas prices here at home. Europe needs to provide the primary financial aid since the war is right on its doorstep. I joined @ShaunKraisman to discuss. https://t.co/lCEpOCaneV

Alzheimerâ€™s and dementia affect over 120,000 folks in our Tennessee communities. This month, we remember the people living with these frightening diseases and thank the family members, health care workers, and professional caretakers who sacrifice so much to care for them. https://t.co/Vpqq8MdJ26

I wrote an article in @NRO about the importance of government transparency regarding unidentified aerial phenomena (UAP). It's time for our defense officials to share what they really know with Congress and the American people. https://t.co/KGB1KrAE8D
